contentTypes.title: Accordion
contentTypes.summary: Create vertically stacked expandable items
contentTypes.description: Reduce the amount of text presented to readers by using this responsive accordion. Readers decide which headlines to take a closer look at by expanding the title. Excellent for providing an overview with optional in-depth explanations.

contentTypes.title: Arithmetic Quiz
contentTypes.summary: Create time-based arithmetic quizzes
contentTypes.description: Create arithmetic quizzes consisting of multiple choice questions. As an author, all you have to do is decide the type and length of the quiz. Users keep track of score and time spent when solving the quiz.

contentTypes.title: Chart
contentTypes.summary: Quickly generate bar and pie charts
contentTypes.description: Need to present simple statistical data graphically without creating the artwork manually? Chart is your answer.

contentTypes.title: Collage
contentTypes.summary: Create a collage of multiple images
contentTypes.description: The Collage tool allows you to organize images into a soothing composition.

screenshots.alt: A collage containing 3 images of flowers
A collage containing 4 images of snowy mountains

contentTypes.title: Column
contentTypes.summary: Organize H5P content into a column layout
contentTypes.description: Organize your content type into a column layout with H5P Column. Content types that address similar material or share a common theme can now be grouped together to create a coherent learning experience. In addition, authors are free to be creative by combining almost all of the existing H5P content types.

screenshots.alt: A column containing an image, a text block and a question
A column containing different content types
A drag and drop inside a column

contentTypes.title: Course Presentation
contentTypes.summary: Create a presentation with interactive slides
contentTypes.description: Course presentations consist of slides with multimedia, text, and many different types of interactions like interactive summaries, multiple choice questions and interactive videos. Learners can experience new interactive learning material and test their knowledge and memory in Course Presentations. As always with H5P, content is editable in web browsers, and the Course Presentation activity type includes a WYSIWYG drag and drop based authoring tool. A typical use of the Course Presentation activity is to use a few slides to introduce a subject and follow these with a few more slides in which the userâ€™s knowledge is tested. Course Presentations may however be used in many different ways, including as a presentation tool for use in the classroom, or as a game where the usual navigation is replaced with navigation buttons on top of the slides to let the user make choices and see the consequences of their choices.

screenshots.alt: Adding an image to the editor
A single Choice Set inside the editor
A single Choice Set and an image of a cloudberry inside the editor
First slide of a presentation containing text and a clickable image
A slide containing video and text

contentTypes.title: Dialog Cards
contentTypes.summary: Create text-based turning cards
contentTypes.description: Dialog cards can be used as a drill to help learners memorize words, expressions or sentences. On the front of the card, there's a hint for a word or expression. By turning the card the learner reveals a corresponding word or expression. Dialog cards can be used in language learning, to present math problems or help learners remember facts such as historical events, formulas or names.

contentTypes.title: Documentation Tool
contentTypes.summary: Create a form wizard with text export
contentTypes.description: The documentation tool aims to make it easy to create assessment wizards for goal driven activities. It can also be used as a form wizard. While editing, the author can add multiple steps to the wizard. In each step, the author can define which content goes into that step. Content can be plain text, input fields, goal definition and goal assessment. Once published, the end user will be taken through the steps of the wizard. On the last step of the wizard, the user can generate a document with all the input that has been submitted. This document can be downloaded. The Documentation tool is fully responsive and works great on smaller screens as well as on your desktop.

screenshots.alt: User's view â€“ document your project
User's view â€“ Document your project

contentTypes.title: Drag and Drop
contentTypes.summary: Create drag and drop tasks with images
contentTypes.description: Drag and drop question enables the learner to associate two or more elements and to make logical connections in a visual way. Create Drag and drop questions using both text and images as draggable alternatives. H5P Drag and drop questions support one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one and many-to-many relations between questions and answers.

screenshots.alt: A drag and drop with one dropzone (strawberry) and three draggables
A drag and drop where the learner shall match flags and country names
A drag and drop where the learner shall match images of berries with their names
A drag and drop where the learner shall drag verbs, adjectives and nouns in the correct places
A drag and drop where the learner shall place the draggables on spots on the background image
The drag and drop result view

contentTypes.title: Drag the Words
contentTypes.summary: Create text-based drag and drop tasks
contentTypes.description: Drag the Words allows content designers to create textual expressions with missing pieces of text. The end user drags a missing piece of text to its correct place, to form a complete expression. May be used to check if the user remembers a text she has read, or if she understands something. Helps the user think through a text. It's super easy to create a drag the words task. The editor just writes the text and encloses the words that are to be draggable with asterisk signs like *draggableWord*.

screenshots.alt: Drag text after clicking the "check" button

contentTypes.title: Fill in the Blanks
contentTypes.summary: Create a task with missing words in a text
contentTypes.description: Learners fill in the missing words in a text. The learner is shown a solution after filling in all the missing words, or after each word depending on settings. Authors enter text and mark words to be replaced with an asterix. In addition to native and second language learning, Fill in the blanks can be used to test the learner's ability to reproduce facts or produce mathematical inferences.

screenshots.alt: The student's initial view - empty blanks
The result view showing corrects and wrongs
A blank with "Automatically check answers after input" enabled

contentTypes.title: Find the Hotspot
contentTypes.summary: Create image hotspots for users to find
contentTypes.description: This content type allows end users to press somewhere on an image and get feedback on whether that was correct or incorrect according to the task description. The author uploads an image and defines various hotspots corresponding to details or sections of the image. Hotspots can either be defined as correct or incorrect, and the author provides appropriate feedback text in both cases. The author can also define a feedback if the end user presses somewhere which is neither defined as a correct nor incorrect hotspot.

screenshots.alt: Learner's view - correct answer is selected

contentTypes.title: Guess the Answer
contentTypes.summary: Create an image with a question and answer
contentTypes.description: This content type allows authors to upload an image and add a suitable description. End users can guess the answer and press the bar below the image to reveal the correct answer.

screenshots.alt: Learner's view revealing the correct answer

contentTypes.title: Iframe Embedder
contentTypes.summary: Embed from a url or a set of files
contentTypes.description: The Iframe embedder makes it easy to make an H5P of already existing JavaScript applications.

contentTypes.title: Interactive Video
contentTypes.summary: Create videos enriched with interactions
contentTypes.description: Add interactivity to your video with explanations, extra pictures, tables, Fill in the Blank and multiple choice questions. Quiz questions support adaptivity, meaning that you can jump to another part of the video based on the user's input.  Interactive summaries can be added at the end of the video. Interactive videos are created and edited using the H5P authoring tool in a standard web browser.

screenshots.alt: The editor with a multiple choice question
Inside the editor showing the multiple choice editor
Drag and drop inside the video
Summary at the end of the video

contentTypes.title: Mark the Words
contentTypes.summary: Create a task where users highlight words
contentTypes.description: Mark the words allows content designers to create textual expressions with a defined set of correct words. The end user highlights words according to the task description and is given a score. For the editor it is super easy to create a click the words challenge. The editor types in the text and encloses the words that the user is supposed to click, the right answers, in asterix like *correctWord*.

contentTypes.title: Memory Game
contentTypes.summary: Create the classic image pairing game
contentTypes.description: Create your own memory games and test the memory of your site's users with this simple yet beautiful HTML5 game.

screenshots.alt: Student's view - feedback after the match
Student's view - matching two different images

contentTypes.title: Multiple Choice
contentTypes.summary: Create flexible multiple choice questions
contentTypes.description: Multiple Choice questions can be an effective assesment tool. The learner is given immediate performance feedback. The H5P Multiple Choice questions can have a single or multiple correct options per question.

contentTypes.title: Personality Quiz
contentTypes.summary: Create personality quizzes
contentTypes.description: In this content type, the author defines a series of questions with alternatives, where each alternative is matched against one or more personalities. At the end of the quiz, the end user will see which personality matches the best. There are several ways of making this quiz visually appealing, by eg. representing questions, alternatives, and personalities using images.

contentTypes.title: Questionnaire
contentTypes.summary: Create a questionnaire to receive feedback
contentTypes.description: Gain feedback and ask open ended questions in Interactive Videos and other content types with Questionnaire. Questionnaire makes the user's answers available via an xAPI integration. This means that website owners may store the answers in many different ways. Answers may be stored in an LRS, the sites own custom storage or a script can fetch the e-mail address and use it to send the user an e-mail. On H5P.org answers are stored in Google Analytics.

contentTypes.title: Quiz (Question Set)
contentTypes.summary: Create a sequence of various question types
contentTypes.description: Question Set is your typical quiz content type. It allows the learner to solve a sequence of various question types such as Multichoice, Drag and drop and Fill in the blanks in a Question set. As an author, there are many settings you can use to make it behave just the way you want it to. You may, for instance, customize the Question set with background images and define a pass percentage for the learner. The Question Set also allows you to add videos that are played at the end. One video for success, another if the learner fails the test. This might motivate learners to try again if they fail so that they get to see the success video.

screenshots.alt: A multiple choice inside a question set
A drag and drop inside a question set
A multiple choice inside a question set

contentTypes.title: Single Choice Set
contentTypes.summary: Create questions with one correct answer
contentTypes.description: Single choice set allows content designers to create question sets with one correct answer per question. The end user gets immediate feedback after submitting each answer.

screenshots.alt: Correct answer given for an alternative

contentTypes.title: Summary
contentTypes.summary: Create tasks with a list of statements
contentTypes.description: Summaries help the learner remember key information in a text, video or presentation, by actively building a summary about the topic at hand. When the learner has completed a summary, a complete list of key statements about the topic is shown.

contentTypes.title: Timeline
contentTypes.summary: Create a timeline of events with multimedia
contentTypes.description: This is Timeline.js developed by Knight Lab, packaged as an H5P content type in order to make timelines easily editable, shareable and reuseable. The Timeline content type allows you to place a sequence of events in a chronological order. For each event you may add images and texts. You may also include assets from Twitter, YouTube, Flickr, Vimeo, Google Maps and SoundCloud.

contentTypes.title: True/False Question
contentTypes.summary: Create True/False questions
contentTypes.description: True/False Question is a simple and straightforward content type that can work by itself or be inserted into other content types such as Course Presentation. A more complex question can be created by adding an image or a video.

contentTypes.title: Image Hotspots
contentTypes.summary: Create an image with multiple info hotspots
contentTypes.description: Image hotspots makes it possible to create an image with interactive hotspots. When the user presses a hotspot, a popup containing a header and text or video is displayed. Using the H5P editor, you may add as many hotspots as you like.

contentTypes.title: Find Multiple Hotspots
contentTypes.summary: Create many hotspots for users to find
contentTypes.description: A free HTML5 based question type allowing creatives to create an image based test where the learner is to find the correct spots on an image. Use this content type with the H5P plugin for WordPress, Moodle or Drupal to challenge your users.

contentTypes.title: Image Juxtaposition
contentTypes.summary: Create interactive images
contentTypes.description: A free HTML5-based image content type that allows users to compare two images interactively. Tell your image stories with H5P and Image Juxtaposition on WordPress, Moodle or Drupal.

contentTypes.title: Audio
contentTypes.summary: Upload an audio recording
contentTypes.description: Upload an audio recording in .mp3, .wav, .ogg or provide the link for an audio recording.

contentTypes.title: Audio Recorder
contentTypes.summary: Create an audio recording
contentTypes.description: An HTML5 audio recorder. Record your voice and play back or download a .wav file of your recording. Use the H5P plugin to create the H5P Audio Recorder to your Drupal, Wordpress or Moodle site.

contentTypes.title: Speak the Words
contentTypes.summary: Answer a question using your voice (Chrome only)
contentTypes.description: Speak the Words is only supported in browsers that implements the Web Speech API (Chrome browsers, except on iOS). You need a microphone to answer the question. Ask a question to users and make them answer using their voice. You can choose multiple correct answers. The user will be able to see what their words were interpreted as, and how close it was to the correct answers.

screenshots.alt: Question text and answer with microphone screen

contentTypes.title: Agamotto (Image Blender)
contentTypes.summary: Present a sequence of images and explanations
contentTypes.description: Present a sequence of images that people are supposed to look at one after the other, e.g. photos of an item that changes over time, schematics or maps that are organized in different layers or images that reveal more and more details.

screenshots.alt: Agamotto shown as a layered map

contentTypes.title: Image Sequencing
contentTypes.summary: Place images in the correct order
contentTypes.description: A free HTML5 based image sequencing content type that allows authors to add a sequence of their own images (and optional image description) to the game in a particular order. The order of the images will be randomized and players will have to reorder them based on the task description.

screenshots.alt: Result screen when one or more is incorrect
Result screen when all image are correctly ordered

contentTypes.title: Flashcards
contentTypes.summary: Create stylish and modern flashcards
contentTypes.description: This content type allows authors to create a single flash card or a set of flashcards, where each card has images paired with questions and answers. Learners are required to fill in the text field and then check the correctness of their solution.

screenshots.alt: Learner has not given any answer yet

contentTypes.title: Speak the Words Set
contentTypes.summary: Create a series of questions answered by speech (Chrome only)
contentTypes.description: Speak the Words Set is only supported in browsers that implement the Web Speech API (Chrome browsers, except on ios). You need a microphone to answer the question. Create a set of questions that learners can answer using their voice. you can choose multiple correct answers. The user will be able to see what their words were interpreted as, and how close it was to the correct answers.

screenshots.alt: An image showing the start screen
An image showing the question screen
An image showing the recording taking place
An image showing a correct answer is given
An image showing the solution view
An image showing the finish screen

contentTypes.title: Image Slider
contentTypes.summary: Easily create an Image Slider
contentTypes.description:
Present your images in an appealing way with ease. Authors just have to upload images and provide alternative texts for the images. 

The next two images are always preloaded so switching between images will usually be snappy with no delay for loading the next image.

Images may be experienced as part of the page or in full-screen mode. When used as part of the page the system will pick a fixed aspect ratio depending on the images being used. Authors may decide to handle aspect ratios differently.

contentTypes.title: Essay
contentTypes.summary: Create Essay with instant feedback
contentTypes.description: In this content type, the author defines a set of keywords that represent crucial aspects of a topic. These keywords are matched against a text that students have composed and can be used to immediately provide feedback - either suggesting to revise certain topic details if a keyword is missing or, confirming the student's ideas if the text contains a keyword.

contentTypes.title: Image Pairing
contentTypes.summary: Drag and drop image matching game
contentTypes.description: Image pairing is a simple and effective activity that require learners to match pairs of images. Since it is not required for both images in a pair to be the same, authors are also able to test the understanding of a relation between two different images.

contentTypes.title: Dictation
contentTypes.summary: Create a dictation with instant feedback
contentTypes.description: You can add audio samples containing a sentence for dictation and enter the correct transcription. Your students can listen to the samples and enter what they have heard in to a text field. Their answers will be evaluated automatically. Several options will allow you to control the exercise's difficulty. You can optionally add a second audio sample for a sentence that could hold a version spoken slowly. You can also set a limit for how often a sample can be played, define if punctuation should be relevant for scoring, and decide whether small mistakes like typing errors should be counted as no mistake, a full mistake, or just a half mistake.

contentTypes.title: Branching Scenario
contentTypes.summary: Create dilemmas and self paced learning
contentTypes.description: Branching Scenario allow authors to present the learners with a variety of rich interactive content and choices. The choices the learners make will determine the next content they see. May be used to create dilemmas, serious games, and self-paced learning.

contentTypes.title: Virtual Tour (360)
contentTypes.summary: Create 360 environments with interactions
contentTypes.description: 360 (equirectangular) and normal images may be enriched with interactivities like explanations, videos, sounds, and interactive questions. The images create scenes that also may be linked together to give the user an impression of moving between environments or between different viewpoints within the same environment.

contentTypes.title: Find the words
contentTypes.summary: Grid word search game
contentTypes.description: A free HTML5-based word search activity that allows authors to create a list of words that will be drawn in a grid. The learner's task is to find and select the words in the grid.

screenshots.alt: Learners has chosen 5 of 12 correct words

contentTypes.title: Interactive Book
contentTypes.summary: Create small courses, books and tests
contentTypes.description: Create small courses, books, or tests. Interactive Book allows authors to combine large amounts of interactive content like interactive videos, questions, course presentations, and more on multiple pages. There is a summary at the end summing up the scores obtained by the learner throughout the book.

contentTypes.title: KewAr Code
contentTypes.summary: Create QR codes for different purposes
contentTypes.description: KewAr Code enables content designers to create well-known QR codes. Those QR codes can encode URLs, but also contact information, events, geo-locations, etc. People can scan them with a QR code reader in order to trigger the chosen action.

screenshots.alt: Customize the display of the QR code

contentTypes.title: Advent Calendar (beta)
contentTypes.summary: Create surprises that will be unveiled daily
contentTypes.description:
Build and customize a beautiful advent calendar. You may add a background image to the entire calendar, on each door, and as a background on the content inside each door. You may also add snow- effect and music. Inside each door, you may add a sound, video, text, image, or link.

Do note that it is easy for computer-savvy users to reveal the content of all doors right away. If you plan to reveal big secrets on future days you should wait until that day before adding your big secrets to the calendar.

contentTypes.title: Crossword
contentTypes.summary: Create a crossword puzzle
contentTypes.description: Build and customize a beautiful crossword to engage your audience. The crossword is highly customizable allowing you to configure all colors, upload a background image, decide how scoring should work and even randomize the words in it so that your audience gets a new crossword each time if you want.

contentTypes.title: Sort the Paragraphs
contentTypes.summary: Create a set of paragraphs to be sorted
contentTypes.description: Type or paste in a list of paragraphs that will be randomized. You may for instance let each paragraph be a part of a song, a block of code or steps in a recipe. Learners are to sort the paragraphs into the correct order. By default learners will get one point for each paragraph that follows the paragraph it is supposed to follow, but you may decide to award a point for each paragraph that is in the correct place instead.

contentTypes.title: Multimedia Choice
contentTypes.summary: Create a task where the alternatives are multimedia
contentTypes.description: Build beautiful multiple or single choice questions where each alternative can be an image, video or audio. You may customize the layout for the alternatives and choose between fixed aspect ratios or just use the aspect ratios the multimedia elements have by default.

screenshots.alt: Images may displayed with a fixed aspect ratio

contentTypes.title: Cornell Notes
contentTypes.summary: Take notes using the Cornell system
contentTypes.description: Present learners with a video, text or audio and encourage them to make notes using the Cornell note taking system.

contentTypes.title: AR Scavenger
contentTypes.summary: Augmented reality fun!
contentTypes.description: Let learners explore reality augmented with 3D models or H5P exercises. You can define markers similar to QR codes that your students can scan with their device's camera. Those markers can trigger blending a 3D model of your choice with the camera view, or they can display an H5P interaction.

screenshots.alt: Starting screen for an AR Scavenger
Phone filming augmented reality marker showing a strawberry

contentTypes.title: Structure Strip
contentTypes.summary: Interactive structure strip
contentTypes.description: A structure strip is traditionally put next to a sheet of paper (or even glued onto it). It provides students with a scaffold for a text and helps them to keep the lengths of different text segments in good proportions. With Structure Strip, you can now use the same approach in H5P without paper.

screenshots.alt: Screenshot of a Structure Strip where the student has filled in a text area

contentTypes.title: Information Wall
contentTypes.summary: Create information panels that users can filter for relevant keywords.
contentTypes.description: Allow users to easily browse all pieces of information or filter them by keywords in order to search for specific information. As author, you can configure a master panel and decide to add an image per panel, etc.

contentTypes.title: Game Map
contentTypes.summary: Let your students choose their exercises on a game map
contentTypes.description: A game map consists of stages that you can arrange on top of a background image. Each stage is connected to one or more stages and can hold an H5P content type for the user to view or complete. You can define rules that will determine what stage the user is allowed to move to, so you can create a game-like experience.
